diagrams.description: Digital Marketing evolved alongside internet and mobile technology adoption. The World Wide Web launch (1991) created the foundation for online marketing. Early banner ads appeared in 1994, marking the first commercial internet advertising. Google's launch (1998) and AdWords (2000) revolutionized search marketing and PPC advertising. Social media platforms emerged in the early 2000s, with Facebook (2004) transforming marketing strategies. YouTube's founding (2005) enabled video marketing at scale. The iPhone launch (2007) ushered in mobile-first marketing. Content marketing gained prominence around 2010 with emphasis on inbound strategies. Marketing automation platforms matured in the 2010s. Influencer marketing exploded with Instagram growth (2012-2015). Voice search and AI-powered personalization emerged in the late 2010s. Today's digital marketing integrates omnichannel strategies, privacy-first approaches, and AI-driven optimization.

    title Digital Marketing Evolution
    1991 : World Wide Web

    1994 : First Banner Ads
         : Commercial internet advertising
    1998 : Google Launch
         : Search engine revolution
    2000 : Google AdWords
         : PPC advertising platform
    2004 : Facebook Founded
         : Social media marketing begins
    2005 : YouTube Created
         : Video marketing scale
    2007 : iPhone Launch
         : Mobile-first marketing era
    2010 : Content Marketing Rise
         : Inbound strategy emphasis
    2012-2015 : Influencer Marketing
              : Instagram-driven growth
    Late 2010s : AI & Voice Search
               : Personalization advances
    2020s : Omnichannel & Privacy
          : Integrated AI-driven strategies
